Description: String of 57 beads and pendant-beads of various shape (globular, lentiform, fusiform, biconical, cylindrical; some pendant-beads pebble-shaped and in the form of poppy seed head) and material (lapis lazuli, agate, amber, diorite, feldspar, garnet, rock crystal, jasper, steatite (?), chalcedony, glass, amethyst, and cornelian).
Curator's comments: Concerning stone and glass beads, see W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 79 § 79. See also the broken pendant-bead London, BM, EA 23502 ( 1887,0101.1166).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 79 § 79)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.85, p.187, pl.29)
